description: A site where users design the most beautiful (or ugly) 404 pages ever, vote on favorites, and download their creation as an inlined HTML.
mvp: A drag-n-drop interface lets users pick templates, colors, headlines, and weird images to make wild 404 error pages. Users can download their creation or enter it into a public “beauty” contest.
dformat: {design_elements: array, screenshot: base64/png, votes: number, htmlcard: string}
build: Build 3-5 error page templates and a drag-n-drop UI. Save each design as a downloadable, self-contained HTML card. Integrate a voting gallery if time permits.
nth: Public voting rounds, monthly “ugliest error” award, randomized glitch effects, export to GitHub Pages.

description: A comedy tool that takes user sentences and translates them word-for-word—no matter how wrong the meaning—into visual puns, gibberish, or meme images.
mvp: Users enter text; the site breaks it down into hyperliteral interpretations, pairing phrases with terrible puns, stick-figure scenes, or mismatched stock photos, shown on a funny interpretation card.
dformat: {input_text: string, interpretations: array, images: array, htmlcard: string}
build: Build text input, parse sentence, and apply premade interpretation rules. Display results as a funny card and enable HTML download.
nth: Option to add custom puns, user-submitted translations, gif mode, “seriousness” slider.

description: An advice website that dispenses wacky, contradictory life advice via spinning wheel, then creates a downloadable “life plan” card based on the roll.
mvp: Users spin a colorful wheel of random guidance; each wedge is a bizarre combo of tips (“Work hard, nap harder”), with an animated reveal. The generated “life advice card” can be downloaded as inlined HTML.
dformat: {advice: array, wheel_result: string, plan_card: string, htmlcard: string}
build: Create a spinner widget with randomized advice on each wedge. Show animated results and card with advice, all downloadable.
nth: Multi-spin combos, user-submitted advice, printable sticker sheet, shareable wheels.

description: A site that drafts hilariously blunt, oversharing social status updates for users based on a mood or topic, then presents them on a downloadable, themed HTML feed card.
mvp: Users enter a topic or select a mood; the site creates a brutally honest, too-much-information update (“Feeling: Existential dread after lunch. Considering buying a llama.”), styled like a fake social feed. Card is downloadable.
dformat: {topic: string, mood: string, status: string, htmlcard: string}
build: Topic/mood input, status generator, feed-style preview card, HTML download.
nth: Save to gallery, “mashup” mode, randomized reactions, fake likes counter.

description: A website for creating printable, over-the-top passive-aggressive notes for roommates, colleagues, or the universe—complete with exaggerated sticker art.
mvp: Users select a template and tweak text, tone, and sticker decorations. Each passive-aggressive message is previewed as a fancy card and downloadable as standalone HTML.
dformat: {note: string, template: string, stickers: array, htmlcard: string}
build: List templates (“kitchen sink,” “break room,” “generic life advice”), editable message field, sticker picker. Render the note with styles and stickers, export as HTML card.
nth: Voice-to-note, sticker randomizer, social sharing, collection of famous passive-aggressive notes.

description: A playful tool to generate tongue-in-cheek auto-reply emails for any situation—with snarky signatures and instant downloadable HTML email views.
mvp: Users pick a scenario (“Out of office,” “Doing nothing important”), set a tone slider (“mild,” “full sarcasm”), and receive a tailor-made auto-reply. The answer is viewable as a stylized HTML email card, ready to download.
dformat: {scenario: string, tone: string, reply: string, htmlcard: string}
build: Build scenario/tone picker → generate reply → style into email HTML → download.
nth: Signature generator, “Inbox of Sarcasm” gallery, custom templates, random emoji stamps.

description: A fast, minimalist site that generates quirky, oddly specific compliments paired with playful icons and lets users download an HTML compliment card.
mvp: Users click “Surprise Me” to get a weirdly specific compliment (“You fold towels with the flair of a master origamist”) and see an accompanying cheerful icon. Compliments can be downloaded instantly as colorful HTML cards.
build: Step 1: Build compliment generator and icon pairings. Step 2: Style vibrant cards. Step 3: One-click download as inlined, standalone HTML.
nth: Compliment history, screenshot mode, customizable color palette, “send to a friend” link.

description: A web app that generates purposely bad digital portraits from selfies or webcam snaps, adding random “awful artist” effects and fake pretentious titles.
mvp: Users take/upload a photo, pick an art style (“cubist disaster,” “child’s first drawing”), and see their new, humorously horrible portrait in a museum-style card with a silly title and description.
dformat: {original_img: base64/png, style: string, portrait_img: base64/png, title: string, description: string, htmlcard: string}
build: Integrate image input and basic image-processing (glitch filter, scribbly effect), then generate random title/description. Display the card as HTML, downloadable as standalone.
nth: Gallery submission, frame selection, art “awards,” portrait battle voting.

description: A tongue-in-cheek site that offers hilariously useless motivational advice and random pep talks with a glitchy animated bot.
mvp: Users click a big “Motivate Me!” button; a cartoon bot appears, delivering a goofy, unhelpful pep talk, animated with blinking lights and random sound effects. Each motivation session generates a unique “sage advice” card, downloadable as HTML.
dformat: {advice: string, bot_animation: string, advice_id: string, htmlcard: string}
build: Prepare a list of absurd motivational lines. Build the animated bot with simple CSS/JS. Show new advice and animation on each click. Render the advice card with unique advice ID for download.
nth: Custom voice options, bot name chooser, user-submitted bad advice, soundboard.

description: Enter your developer or company info, instantly create an obnoxiously self-congratulatory About page bio, with toggles for “humblebrag” and “satirical brag.”
mvp: Enter info, pick mode, generate, view, and copy.
build: Template logic, phrase DB, JS/CSS/HTML.
nth: Share as meme-image, copy to clipboard.

description: Auto-detects new acronyms in company docs, creates ridiculous but plausible definitions, lets users vote on their favorites, and outputs the “official” absurd usage guide.
mvp: 1. Upload docs or paste text. 2. Find acronyms. 3. Generate silly definitions. 4. Vote and download usage guide.
build: 1. Doc parser. 2. Definition generator. 3. Voting module. 4. Guide exporter.
nth: Shareable acronyms, emoji reactions to definitions, annual “Best of” ranking.

description: Big central icon/emoji and goofy random snack name (“Pickle Popsicles”, “Wasabi Cereal”). Each click serves a fresh idea, all on one clean canvas.
mvp: Single “Next Snack” button, name and emoji in huge font, minimal padding, snack data drawn from local array. Animated emoji when you click.
build: HTML/CSS centered flex, JS for array rotation, rotate emoji and snack on click. Mobile and desktop friendly, all data in one file.
nth: Download snack idea as a card, “Build a snack pack” list, confetti pop for rare ideas, animated snack icons.

description: Build layered habits step-by-step: stack new routines, set triggers/rewards, log progress, reflect with guided journaling, and visualize streaks and setbacks.
mvp: 1. Define a new habit step; link to triggers and rewards. 2. Stack or split habits into phases. 3. Log completions; add quick reflections. 4. See visual analytics of progress/streaks/setbacks.
dformat: Habit data as JSON: {user_id, habits[{id, triggers, rewards, phases, logs, reflections}]}
build: 1. Multi-step habit builder. 2. Trigger/reward selector. 3. Daily tracking/journaling. 4. Analytics dashboard.
nth: Peer accountability, app reminders, motivational quotes, habit library import/export.

description: Enter learning goals and topics, auto-split into daily study steps, generate sessions, track progress with quizzes/recaps, and adapt plan based on strengths/weaknesses.
mvp: 1. Set topic/goal. 2. Generate stepwise sessions. 3. Take micro-quizzes. 4. Track progress/adapt schedule.
dformat: Plan data as JSON: {user_id, topics, sessions, results}
build: 1. Session/planner generator. 2. Quiz/recap logic. 3. Adaptive progress tracker. 4. Export/notifications.
nth: Crowd-contributed topic lists, group study mode, import from syllabi, streak rewards.

description: Instantly cook up ridiculous, boastful or too-honest bios for social media, exported as fake “profile screenshots.”
mvp: Choose a vibe (humblebrag, drama queen, boring realist…), get a bio + profile image, export as HTML card.
dformat: {vibe: string, bio: string, profile_pic: string, htmlcard: string}
build: Vibe selector, random bio, avatar, fake screenshot card.
nth: “Bio Battle Royale,” switch formats (LinkedIn, Tinder, etc.), remix avatar.

description: Press “Apologize,” receive a ridiculous bot apology (“Sorry, I can’t find your lost socks in RAM”). Everything is ultra-minimal and vertical, only one apology per press.
mvp: Center button, apology display, apology messages pulled locally, single column flow, fast interaction, no menus.
build: Organize HTML with flexbox, JS array for apologies, style button with maximum legibility, instant swap logic.
nth: “Apologize again” shortcut key, random emoji included, gentle bounce effect on apology text.

description: A semi-sincere bot that writes bizarre, melodramatic apology notes for everyday screw-ups and lets users download them as comically formal HTML apology cards.
mvp: Pick a mishap (“Ate your snack,” “Forgot your call”); bot crafts a tongue-in-cheek apology using excessive language (“Deeply, earnestly, we regret…”). Delivered as a fancy apology card.
dformat: {mishap: string, apology_note: string, bot_signature: string, htmlcard: string}
build: Mishap selector, apology generator, signature, card download.
nth: “Forgiveness Meter,” random dramatic backgrounds, share-to-friend link, apology history gallery.

description: Level up apologies by picking your “offense,” choosing the drama style, adding exaggerated gifts, and watching your apology unfold through music, animation, and wild e-cards.
mvp:
1. Offense selection from funny templates or custom input.
2. Choose apology tone: sincere, dramatic, or deliberately overblown.
3. Add gifts, props, and “witness” characters.
4. Animated apology preview with music and downloadable GIF/e-card.
dformat: JSON templates for offenses, gifts, apology types, and animation data; session/cookie for progress and preview.
build:
1. Populate interactive offense, gift, and style data.
2. Multi-step builder with state tracking (React/Svelte).
3. Animated apology effects and live preview.
4. Export/download animated or static apology as image/GIF.
nth: Leaderboard for apologies, public apology wall, “challenge a friend” mode.

description: Multi-step applicant review: weighted criteria creation, team scoring, group comments, dynamic shortlist builder, and reporting—all in one secure app.
mvp: 1. Create application criteria and weightings. 2. Reviewers score/group comment as they rate. 3. Shortlist and export final results.
dformat: Applicant data as JSON: {app_id, criteria[{name, weight}], reviewers, scores, comments, shortlist}
build: 1. Criteria builder UI. 2. Reviewer/team scoring logic. 3. Shortlist/calculation engine. 4. Report exporter.
nth: Email invites, role permissions, track recusal/disputes, export to HR systems.

description: Generates mildly chaotic polite responses for group chats or emails when you cannot, will not, or just shouldn’t.
mvp: Paste thread, choose “vibe” (formal, casual, offbeat), see 3 responses, copy or auto-insert.
build: HTML/CSS/JS, uses text templates, no external deps.
nth: Include emoji, sarcasm dial, save favorites.

description: Connect email or Discord. Any time you receive a compliment, the bot auto-sends a “thank you” message (with the option for a silly emoji).
mvp: Link account, auto-thank away!
build: Minimal bot integration, slim UI.
nth: “Add custom thank-you style” option.

description: Tracks birthdays, schedules funny reminders, suggests surprise party plans, picks “joke of the day” cards, and automates a digital group card signing.
mvp: 1. Add birthdays. 2. Set up party/reminder styles. 3. Suggest jokes/cards. 4. Report results/share cards.
dformat: Birthday data: {user_id, birthday, reminder_style, jokes, card_signers}
build: 1. Date tracker. 2. Reminder/joke engine. 3. Group card module. 4. Analytics/export.
nth: AI song generator, birthday quiz, play virtual cakes.

description: A bot-powered website that delivers absurd, AI-created excuses for any situation and lets users download/share their “Official Excuse Note” as HTML.
mvp: Users pick a scenario (“Late for work,” “Missed deadline,” “Forgot birthday”), and the bot instantly creates a hilariously elaborate excuse with a comical stamp and animated delivery. Excuse is shown as a sharable HTML card.
dformat: {scenario: string, excuse: string, bot_avatar: string, htmlcard: string}
build: Step 1: List scenarios, randomize detailed excuses. Step 2: Render bot/avatar animation and excuse card. Step 3: Quick download/export.
nth: Submit own excuses, text-to-speech mode, printable triplicate forms, “Excuse of the Day” leaderboard.

description: A web page with a giant “Generate Error” button. Pressing it fills the screen with a randomly generated, laughably absurd error message (“Error 418 – Coffee Pot Is Feeling Shy”).
mvp: Single button, fullscreen layout, error message in huge font, random selection from error list, button press swaps instantly, zero UI clutter.
build: Write up error list in JS, style simple fullscreen, button wired to randomize and animate message, mobile & desktop friendly.
nth: Share error, “Copy to clipboard,” random error sound, dark/light toggle.

description: An interactive website where you pick a social scenario and play through the most cringe-worthy conversation options possible—with bonus points for awkwardness.
mvp:
- Pick a scenario (e.g. elevator, office party, first date)
- Dialogue tree with multiple response choices (most points for awkward responses)
- Animated facial reactions or emojis
- Awkwardness score at game-end
build:
1. Write a few short conversation scripts/scenarios
2. Build branching dialogue UI and reaction system
3. Score and summarize performance
nth: - “Ultimate Awkwardness” leaderboard

description: Practice surviving ridiculous social situations by navigating awkward simulated conversations, choosing from cringe-worthy options. Watch animated reactions, track your “awkwardness” score, and share your funniest moments.
mvp:
1. Choose a scenario: party, job interview, family dinner, elevator.
2. Dialogue is step-based; for each prompt, pick a response (cringe/funny/weird).
3. Animated characters react to each answer with increasing awkwardness.
4. Final awkwardness/greatness score, recap, and exportable meme “Survivor” card.
dformat: Local arrays for scenarios, responses, reaction logic; session for tracking run.
build:
1. Write scenario-response tree, and build reaction/animation modules.
2. Dialogue stepper UI and score tracker engine.
3. Animated character feedback after each answer.
4. Result summary page with export/share meme.
nth: Scenario creator; public “Most Awkward” board; speech/audio mode.

description: An interactive, comic-style website where users are dropped into cringey social scenarios and must choose cringe-worthy conversation options at every step. Animated character reactions, a “cringe meter,” and branching conversation trees keep the story unpredictable and funny, with extra rewards for pushing awkwardness to the limit.
mvp: 1. Library of scenario templates with multi-step choices. 2. Interactive branching dialogues and reaction animations after each user choice. 3. Cringe-meter scoring after each response. 4. Summary and shareable “cringe outcome” at session end.
dformat: Scenarios and choices stored as JSON trees: {scenario_id, nodes[{user_choice, npc_reaction, cringe_delta}], result_summary}
build: 1. Draft 10-15 scenarios and dialogue trees in structured JSON. 2. Build scenario selector and dialogue UI. 3. Add animated emoji or character feedback and cringe scoring logic. 4. Develop summary/share panel with social sharing abilities.
nth: Unlockable bonus scenarios, create-your-own-scenario, voiceover mode, custom avatars.

description: Practice (or sabotage) cringe-inducing small talk—choose scenarios, respond with awkward options, and trigger animated reactions in a branching dialogue game.
mvp:
1. Scenario picker with diverse cringe settings (elevator, wedding, tech support).
2. Multi-step conversation with branching awkward response options.
3. Animated character feedback/reactions tied to choice tree.
4. Score at end ("Cringe Level," "Survival Rate"), with downloadable certificate.
dformat: JSON/object for scenarios, stateful dialogue tree, user choice log, animated sprite/asset map, PDF/PNG certificate.
build:
1. Create scenario/dialogue trees and link to animation triggers.
2. Build step-by-step dialogue engine.
3. Integrate scoring and feedback.
4. Animated output and export certificate.
nth: Scenario randomizer; voice-acted cringe; global, shareable leaderboard.

description: This site turns mundane situations into exaggerated, overblown metaphors (“My Zoom call: a carnival of pixelated chaos”).
mvp: Users pick or input a scenario, get an artsy/funny metaphor, plus a matching stock photo meme.
dformat: {situation: string, metaphor: string, meme_image: string, htmlcard: string}
build: Metaphor generator, meme matcher, card layout.
nth: Remix button, “Metaphor Battle” mode, random background swaps.

description: Enter a product or topic, instantly get a list of horribly awkward and confusing metaphors you can force into any presentation.
mvp: Enter topic, click generate, laugh/regret, export as list.
build: JS generator, database of phrases, HTML output.
nth: “Make it even weirder” power-up, favorite button.

description: Hit a button when a conversation stalls — get a random icebreaker, joke, or topic rush out of the digital wings to save you.
mvp: Large “save me!” button, random prompt/joke generator, animated reaction emoji, “next!” button, favorites list.
build: HTML/CSS/JS, array of prompts/jokes, basic emoji animation via CSS.
nth: Add your own prompts, share by link, “auto” mode for the chronically awkward.

description: Pick a social situation. Get a one-page “script” for surviving it—with bonus cringe escape lines.
mvp: Pick scenario, laugh, survive.
build: Scenario dropdown, script appears, minimal styles.
nth: “Give me the extra-cringe escape hatch” toggle.

description: A parody “life coach” that delivers the most unhelpful and silly advice.
mvp:
- “Coach, Help!” button
- Card with randomized, ridiculous advice, coach photo/avatar
- Downloadable “Life Plan” with 3 bad pieces of advice
dformat: - Array of advice snippets, fake coach names, avatars (inline SVG/base64)
build:
1. Write funny advice and coach names
2. Build card interface and randomizer
3. Add “download plan” with inlined assets
nth: Coach impersonations, style switcher (motivational/cynical/etc.), user-submitted advice

description: For brainstorming wild blog concepts: mix random trending topics, unusual tones, and weird constraints, then rate, save, or spin again for more.
mvp: 1. Pick or randomize ingredients. 2. AI blends unique blog idea. 3. Rate/save/share or spin again.
build: 1. Trend topic grabber. 2. Mixer engine. 3. Save/share/rate UI. 4. “Spin again” randomizer.
nth: Hall of Fame for strangest combos, surprise idea challenges.

description: Enter a topic and get five randomly spun blog title prompts that are practical, playful, or totally absurd.
mvp: Enter seed idea, click spin, browse title prompts.
build: JS title generator, prompt logic.
nth: “Playful/Serious/Absurd” filter, export all titles at once.

description: Gather online (or solo) to play multi-step, interactive “Bull Bingo” during fake or real meetings. Users fill a card with jargon, nonsense phrases, or coworker quirks, then tap live as clichés fly. Bonus: “Boss React” animations and ridiculous meeting outcomes as cards fill.
mvp: 1. Bingo card setup—choose or randomize phrases, save custom boards. 2. Live bingo marking and round progress, with each bingo triggering a random in-meeting event or boss animation. 3. Multi-user option to join a room with shared game progress. 4. End-of-meeting summary with sarcastic awards.
dformat: Games stored as JSON: {game_id, players, card_phrases, callouts, events[{phrase, user, animation, timestamp}], results}
build: 1. Bingo board logic, phrase generator, and card customization. 2. Real-time marking and event triggers. 3. Room code and multi-user state tracking. 4. Meeting end summary and share features.
nth: Download custom boards, add soundboard of meeting noises, “worst jargon award,” integration with real calendar.

description: Add, tag, and organize bookmarks at breakneck speed—import/export as one-click files. No logins, no ads, just über-organized links.
mvp: URL/title input, quick-add, tag input, bookmark list/grid, import/export JSON or HTML bookmarks.
build: All-in-one-file HTML/CSS/JS, data stored in browser, clear minimal card view, drag and drop to sort/reorder.
nth: Favicon fetch, search/filter bookmarks, color tag labels, “favorite” toggle per bookmark.

description: When a user asks “Hey bot, compliment me,” a playful, sometimes backhanded bot compliment appears (“You have the best HTTP requests I’ve ever seen”). Minimal UI, monochrome palette.
mvp: Input field with “Compliment me” button, compliment pops up, compliments stored in array, button disables until a new compliment is ready, no avatar.
build: Layout input, button, and response with flex; wire input and click event to random compliment generation; all logic client-side.
nth: Animated typing effect for bot, random background accent, button changes text to “More, please” after first use.

description: A bot “mood light.” Big emoji face that changes with each click and offers a silly bot-status caption (“System Optimism at 87%!”). Only one object on screen at a time.
mvp: Emoji rendered in center, status text below, click cycles to next mood/status from a fixed list, mobile and desktop scale.
build: Use HTML/CSS for scaling, JS array with moods and statuses, click event triggers swap, design for clarity and whitespace.
nth: Option to copy mood, subtle emoji pulse, toggle showing code of mood as text.

description: Push a button, get assigned a bot-given nickname (“Captain Bugsnax,” “Java Jester”). Displayed in bold, giant text with instant re-roll on click.
mvp: Large button, nickname display, nickname array, one-click new nickname, full-width layout, all logic client-side, no extras visible.
build: HTML, CSS, JS only; store array of quirky nicknames; button click swaps nickname instantly with subtle fade or wiggle animation.
nth: “Nickname history,” download badge, random color palette, confetti burst on rare nickname.

description: Experience the thrill of inefficiency: users submit tasks, only to face endless forms, pointless approvals, and roundabout micro-bots before achieving anything—each automated “helper” with its quirky personality.
mvp:
1. User submits a simple request (“give me a cat picture”).
2. Automated bots route requests through increasingly absurd steps (form filling, rubber-stamping, “review committees”).
3. Each bot adds delays, comments, or asks for extra info, all with animated chatter.
4. At the end, deliver the item—with a certificate of frustration or achievement.
dformat: Queued request system, modular step-bots, log of steps/events, exportable certificate.
build:
1. Task input and event chain logic.
2. Simulate bots/interactions and comment flows.
3. Animated progress/status tracker.
4. Certificate generation and export.
nth: Customizable bureaucracy themes, unlockable bots, multi-user queue.

description: Guide users through multi-step proposal creation: input client info, pick visual themes, auto-fill sections, preview, and export as branded docs or presentations.
mvp: 1. Enter project/client details. 2. Pick template/theme. 3. Fill in step-by-step sections with autofill/suggestions. 4. Review, tweak, and export as PDF or slides.
dformat: Proposal data as JSON: {user_id, proposal[{client, sections, theme, export}]}
build: 1. Template picker and autofill module. 2. Sectioned editor. 3. Preview/export logic. 4. Brand/logo uploader.
nth: Collaborative edit, e-signature, revision history, CRM integration.

description: Instantly generates a startup “pitch” bursting at the seams with the latest buzzwords—because sometimes you just want to sound like you’re ready for funding.
mvp:
- Button: “Generate Pitch”
- Output: startup name, one-liner motto, buzzword salad description
- Export pitch as downloadable or shareable card (standalone HTML)
dformat: - Arrays of startup name parts, buzzwords, slogans
build:
1. Assemble banks of names, buzzwords, slogans
2. Build generator and display UI
3. Add export/share button (standalone HTML card)
nth:
- “Investor feedback” mode (absurd VC commentary)
- Buzzword bingo mini-game

description: Blocks out random “focus” times in your web calendar—no more back-to-back meetings, with goofy fake reasons for busy.
mvp: OAuth to your calendar, select duration/frequency, auto-generates events with silly titles.
build: JS with Google Calendar API, OAuth2, random title generator.
nth: “Just Block Lunch” mode, sync preview, downloadable .ics.

description: Stepwise simulator to practice real interview scenarios: pick a job, answer custom or randomly generated questions, get feedback after each round, and auto-generate a summary with improvement areas and resource links.
mvp: 1. Select job/role and skill focus. 2. Multi-step mock interview with live prompts and answer input. 3. After every step, targeted feedback and tips. 4. Summary report with tracking and downloadable review notes.
dformat: Interviews as JSON: {session_id, role, questions[{q, user_answer, ai_feedback}], scores, tips}
build: 1. Database of questions/answers by role. 2. Multi-step interview and feedback logic. 3. Scoring and personalized improvement plan builder. 4. Summary/notes export.
nth: Video response mode, industry expert Q&A packs, timed challenges, peer review integration.

description: Automates recognition and squad celebrations with random surprise events, customizable e-cards, goofy digital fireworks, and a leaderboard for party participation.
mvp: 1. Add achievements or occasions. 2. Schedule surprise party. 3. Generate custom cards/fireworks. 4. Track participation.
dformat: CelebrationLog: {occasion, scheduled, participants, cards, effects, scores}
build: 1. Occasions manager. 2. Scheduler. 3. Card/animation generator. 4. Participation tracker.
nth: Event photo gallery, “Who forgot the cake?” meter, award stickers.

description: Page with a single, intimidating checkbox. Checking or unchecking triggers a bot-generated dramatic reaction, such as “Thank you for empowering the Checkbox Overlord, human.”
mvp: Giant checkbox centered, response text shown/hidden based on state, list of random responses, all state managed locally.
build: HTML input, CSS for big visuals, JS maps toggle to local responses, show/hide animation for text, nothing else interactive.
nth: “Undo” with glitch effect, rare golden checkbox state, animated checkbox after 3 toggles.

description: Assigns chores using quirky criteria, rotates tasks, alerts team/housemates, and tracks completion with a leaderboard for most heroic (or disastrous) efforts.
mvp: 1. Enter chore list/participants. 2. Randomize assignment. 3. Send alerts. 4. Track/score progress.
dformat: Chore data: {home_id, chores, assignees, rotation, scores}
build: 1. Chore/participant manager. 2. Assignment/rotation logic. 3. Alert module. 4. Leaderboard/export.
nth: Create “mini boss” challenge events, themed reward stickers.

description: Paste a clickbait headline, get a boring, hyper-accurate factual version in return. Compare side-by-side.
mvp: Paste headline, get anti-clickbait rewrite, split view compare.
build: JS for rewrite logic, CSS for side-by-side.
nth: “Make it more boring” slider, download infographic badge.

description: Generates bizarre, algorithmically mashed-up clickbait headlines (“You Won’t Believe What This Avocado Did Next!”) and sample story snippets. Export as news card.
mvp: Choose a topic, generate headline + snippet, download as mock article card.
dformat: {topic: string, headline: string, snippet: string, htmlcard: string}
build: Topic picker, headline gen, snippet output, card format.
nth: Randomize tone (scandal, mystery, science-y), random “sponsorship” logos, share to social.

description: Tracks your clipboard—view and recall past copies, search history, and pin favorites, all offline.
mvp: Clipboard monitor, entry list, search, pin/favorite, delete/all-clear, optional night mode.
build: HTML/JS/CSS, clipboard API, stores in localStorage, hotkey support.
nth: Export clips as text, sync between devices, “ignore” mode for sensitive data.

description: Flip a digital coin to answer your deepest questions, but the answers are existentially unhelpful (“Maybe!” “Why not?” “Try a sandwich”).
mvp: Button, random answer, flat monochrome look.
build: Flip, display result.
nth: Secret keyboard Easter egg for “Ask again.”

description: A digital coin flip app, where the answer is always a ridiculous, cryptic phrase instead of heads or tails (“Try a sandwich!”). Everything is oversized and clean.
mvp: MVP: one huge flip button, large animated coin, random phrase shown on flip, phrases array in JS.
build: Build plan: coin graphic using CSS or SVG, click triggers coin spin and new random answer, design for pure simplicity.
nth: Nice-to-haves: “Philosophize Again” button, sound on flip, option to add your own answers.

description: Multi-user idea session app: stepwise brainstorming prompts, group clustering, voting, tracked contributions, export/share final ideaboards—all from a live interactive canvas.
mvp: 1. Set topic and invite users. 2. Run timed/multi-step brainstorming sprints. 3. Cluster, organize, and vote on ideas. 4. Export ideaboard.
dformat: Session data as JSON: {session_id, prompts, users, ideas[{id, text, votes}]}
build: 1. Idea entry/canvas module. 2. Clustering/voting logic. 3. Collaborative real-time sync. 4. Export/share.

nth: More unit types, custom unit definitions.

description: A simple tool to convert length units (e.g., meters to feet, inches to centimeters).
mvp:

description: Simulate a day as a bizarre CEO—make choices, dodge wild dilemmas, and issue hilarious "executive decisions" in a branching story app.
mvp:
1. Branching scenario engine with multi-step user decision interface.
2. Dynamic "Crisis Inbox" fed by randomized, escalating funny problems.
3. Decision modifier panel (e.g., mood, costume, or fake assistant’s advice).
4. Scoreboard tracking “Legacy,” “Company Chaos,” and “Public Ridicule.”
5. Final summary screen with downloadable personalized "CEO of the Year*" certificate (asterisk: for dubious reasons).
dformat: Scenario trees (JSON or object), state tracking arrays (user choices/history), user profile object, certificate export as PDF/PNG.
build:
1. Define scenario/decision data model and write branching narrative logic.
2. Build multi-step UI with inbox, decision-making, and modifiers as discrete steps.
3. Implement scoreboard/comedy logic tied to decisions.
4. Integrate PDF/PNG exporter for end summary.
5. Add persistent user progress storage/session.
6. Test for bug-proofing complex branches.
nth: Add more CEO types and randomizer events; animated avatars/office upgrades; shareable "decision replay" links.

description: A wiki-style platform dedicated to hilariously incorrect “facts.” Users submit and collaboratively edit wildly inaccurate encyclopedia entries, complete with fake citations and satirical sources. Each entry evolves through multi-step community edits to maximize comedic wrongness. Safe boundaries around content are enforced to avoid anything offensive or truly misleading.
mvp: 1. Browsing and searching for topics and entries. 2. Generator for users to submit new wrong answers or edit existing ones. 3. Collaborative, multi-step editing system with edit history per entry. 4. Voting for the “Most Wrong” and “Funniest Citation.”
dformat: Entries are structured as JSON: {topic, wrong_fact, citations, contributors, upvotes, edits, revision_history}
build: 1. Design entry and database schema for storing multi-step edits. 2. Create browsing, submission, and editing UI flows. 3. Implement community voting and display system for featured entries and citations. 4. Build history tracking per entry so users can view evolution of each topic.
nth: Community live-edit mode, random “fact generator,” monthly leaderboards, download hilarious PDFs.
